Name: West Valley Medical Center
Capital_and_project_history__c:
• $3 million expansion and renovation of the surgery department, adding 2,771 square feet of operating and recovery space, completed in January 2016 (Source: https://westvalleymedctr.com/about/newsroom/west-valley-begins-6-25-million-expansion-of-surgery-department)
• $7 million construction of a three-story medical office building, completed in 2004 (Source: https://idahobusinessreview.com/2003/12/01/construction-of-new-7m-medical-building-set-for-caldwell/)
Debt_appetite_constraints__c:
• Current debt: $43.0B at 2024-12-31 (HCA consolidated); $44.5B at 2025-06-30. ([sec.gov](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/860730/000095017025020134/hca-20241231.htm?utm_source=openai))
• Capacity: $6.21B available under the credit facility at 2025-06-30; company also actively uses public senior notes markets. ([investor.hcahealthcare.com](https://investor.hcahealthcare.com/news/news-details/2025/HCA-Healthcare-Reports-Second-Quarter-2025-Results/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))
• Recent activity: Issued $4.5B senior notes in 2024; repaid $2.0B notes due 2024; continued issuances/rating actions supportive of ongoing access; facility refinancing and new revolver in early 2025 (BBB-). ([sec.gov](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/860730/000095017025020134/hca-20241231.htm?utm_source=openai))
General_Company_Description__c: West Valley Medical Center is a 150-bed, nationally accredited hospital located in Caldwell, Idaho. Established in 1920, it has been a cornerstone of the community, offering high-quality, cost-effective healthcare services. The facility provides a comprehensive range of services, including emergency care, cardiology, general surgery, spine care, orthopedics, pediatrics, behavioral health, urology, and women's services. With a dedicated staff of over 800 employees and volunteers, the hospital is committed to delivering compassionate and personalized care to the residents of the Treasure Valley. As part of the HCA Healthcare family since 1975, West Valley Medical Center continues to upgrade technology and offer advanced procedures to meet the evolving healthcare needs of the community. )
General_Company_News__c:
• In August 2025, West Valley Medical Center expanded its dedicated orthopedic and spine care space to enhance patient services. ([westvalleymedctr.com](https://westvalleymedctr.com/?utm_source=openai))
• In July 2025, the hospital launched a Mental Health Intensive Outpatient Program (MHIOP) to meet the growing mental health needs of the community. ([westvalleymedctr.com](https://westvalleymedctr.com/?utm_source=openai))
• In April 2024, West Valley Medical Center was recognized with the Healthgrades' 2024 Patient Safety Excellence Award™, marking the eighth consecutive year the hospital received this honor. ([westvalleymedctr.com](https://westvalleymedctr.com/about/newsroom/west-valley-medical-center-among-nations-best-for-patient-safety?utm_source=openai))
Infrastructure_upgrades__c:
• Expansion and renovation of the surgery department, adding 2,771 square feet of operating and recovery space, completed in January 2016 (Source: https://westvalleymedctr.com/about/newsroom/west-valley-begins-6-25-million-expansion-of-surgery-department)
• Construction of a three-story medical office building, completed in 2004 (Source: https://idahobusinessreview.com/2003/12/01/construction-of-new-7m-medical-building-set-for-caldwell/)
Long_term_financial_outlook__c: Capital Projects: • 2022–2025 multi-year interior refresh completed 2025-04-23 (surgery space, BHU, Med/Surg, Ortho/Spine, ER/Main lobbies) – described as a multi-million-dollar program. • 2015–2016 surgery department expansion ($6.25M). • 2025-08-04 enhanced dedicated ortho & spine space; 2025-07-17 launch of Mental Health Intensive Outpatient Program. These reflect ongoing reinvestment while leveraging HCA’s system resources. ([westvalleymedctr.com](https://www.westvalleymedctr.com/about-us/newsroom/west-valley-celebrates-completion-of-multi-million-dollar-refresh?utm_source=openai))
Off_balance_sheet_financing__c: Off-balance appetite: Moderate - HCA Healthcare's substantial debt and recent capital investments indicate a potential interest in off-balance sheet financing options like EaaS, but the preference for preserving debt capacity and lack of explicit energy initiatives suggest it may not be immediately prioritized. Confidence: 70% based on available financial data and strategic considerations.
Past_future_capital_uses__c: • Multi-million dollar interior refresh completed in April 2025, including upgrades to surgery space, Behavioral Health Unit, Medical Surgical floor, Orthopedic and Spine floor, and main and emergency room lobbies (Source: https://www.westvalleymedctr.com/about-us/newsroom/west-valley-celebrates-completion-of-multi-million-dollar-refresh)
Recent_disclosures__c:
• 2024-02-20 S&P rating action: BBB- issue-level rating assigned to HCA Inc.'s proposed senior notes (parent of West Valley Medical Center). ([alacrastore.com](https://www.alacrastore.com/s-and-p-credit-research/HCA-Inc-s-Proposed-Senior-Notes-Rated-BBB-3127550?utm_source=openai))
• 2024-02-23/2024-09-15 Bond offerings: HCA Inc. issued an aggregate $4.5B of senior notes in multiple tranches (5.60% due 2034; 5.45% due 2031; later 5.95% due 2054; 6.00% due 2054/2054–2064 series), using proceeds to repay ABL borrowings/near-term maturities. ([contracts.justia.com](https://contracts.justia.com/companies/hca-healthcare-625/contract/1269294/?utm_source=openai))
• 2024-12-31 Debt maturity activity: Repaid $2.0B 5.000% senior notes due 2024 at maturity. ([sec.gov](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/860730/000095017025020134/hca-20241231.htm?utm_source=openai))
• 2023-05-01 S&P rating on proposed HCA notes: BBB- (context for 2023–2024 activity). ([alacrastore.com](https://www.alacrastore.com/s-and-p-credit-research/HCA-Inc-2244812?utm_source=openai))

Debt__c:
• Leases (parent-level): Operating lease liabilities $2.21B (assets $2.13B) and finance lease liabilities $0.79B at 2024-12-31; total lease liabilities ≈$2.99B (weighted-average discount ~5%). Facility-level breakdown not disclosed. ([sec.gov](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/860730/000095017025020134/hca-20241231.htm?utm_source=openai))
• Pension/benefit obligations (parent-level, nonqualified): Accrued benefits under restoration/SERP plans ~$338M at 2024-12-31. Facility-level pension obligations not separately disclosed. ([content-archive.fast-edgar.com](https://content-archive.fast-edgar.com/20250214/AP2GV222ZM228252222Q2C42DEI9ZK22B272/?utm_source=openai))
